meaning_eng: To confirm an agreement or a business deal; to strike a bargain.
equivalents_eng: To shake hands on it.

meaning_de: Etw. unmittelbar von j-m erfahren.
literal_eng: To learn something from the first hands.
meaning_eng: To receive information direct from a primary source without intermediaries.
equivalents_eng: At first hand.

meaning_de: Sich von der Verantwortung für etw., von der unmittelbaren Beteiligung an etw. zuriickziehen.
literal_eng: To go into the scrubs.
meaning_eng: To withdraw from one’s promise or an undertaking; to disclaim further responsibility for something.
equivalents_eng: To make oneself scarce; to back out; to show the white feather.

meaning_de: In Gedanken versunken sein; ungesellig werden.
literal_eng: To go into one’s own self.
meaning_eng: To become withdrawn, uncommunicative; to become less sociable and more reserved.
equivalents_eng: To retire into oneself

literal_de: Mit dem Kopf in etw. versinken.
meaning_de: Sich einer Sache voll und ganz widmen; sich in eine Sache stürzen.
literal_eng: To go headlong into something.
meaning_eng: To be fully absorbed, deeply engrossed or totally involved in something.
equivalents_eng: To throw oneself/plunge into something; to get up to one’s neck in something.

meaning_de: J-n in scharfer Form auffordern, zu gehen; j-n hinausjagen.
literal_eng: to point to the door.
meaning_eng: Peremptorily to ask a person, whose presence is unwelcome, to leave the house, room, etc.
equivalents_eng: To show someone the door

meaning_de: Der Beteiligung an etw. ausweichen; die Verantwortung für etw. von sich wälzen.
literal_eng: To wash one’s hands
meaning_eng: To divest oneself of any further connection with or responsibility for something; to abandon the matter entirely.
equivalents_eng: To wash one’s hands of something.

meaning_de: Eilig, rasch fortgehen; fliehen.
equivalents_de: die Beine unter den Arm nehmen
literal_eng: To carry away one’s legs.
meaning_eng: To flee; to run as fast as one’s legs will carry one: to have a narrow escape.
equivalents_eng: To escape by the skin of one’s teeth.

literal_de: Vom Himmel auf die Erde fallen.
meaning_de: Sich von Illusionen lösen; die Dinge nüchtern zu betrachten beginnen; aus Träumen zur Wirklichkeit zurückkehren.
literal_eng: To fall from the sky to the earth.
meaning_eng: To be disillusioned; to abandon fantasy and return to practical realities.
equivalents_eng: To come down to earth.

meaning_de: Einen Skandal machen; j-m sein Mißfallen bekunden.
literal_eng: To make a scene.
meaning_eng: To start a noisy or violent argument, quarrel or scrap with someone, expressing one’s dissatisfaction, irritation, etc.
equivalents_eng: To stage/kick up a row; to make a scene.

meaning_de: J-m gegenüber seine Überlegenheit beweisen; j-n übertrumpfen.
literal_eng: To wipe someone’s nose.
meaning_eng: To win an advantage over someone; to humiliate or cause disgruntlement; to make a clever retort.
equivalents_eng: To score off someone; to get the better of someone; to steal a march on someone.

meaning_de: Es macht auf das Gehör einen unangenehmen Eindruck.
literal_eng: Something cuts one’s ear.
meaning_eng: It’s grating upon one’s ears; it’s painful to listen to; it offends the ear.

meaning_de: Man kann es nicht mehr anhören, da es zu dumm, zu unsinnig, derb ist.
literal_eng: One’s ears fade.
meaning_eng: It is so ridiculous, absurd or silly that it’s disgusting to listen to.
equivalents_eng: It makes one sick to hear about it

meaning_de: Herausragende Fähigkeiten besitzen; sehr begabt sein.
literal_eng: To snatch the stars from the sky.
meaning_eng: To be very good at something; to be able to do something remarkable.
equivalents_eng: He is as good as they come

meaning_de: In Verzweiflung geraten.
literal_eng: To clutch one’s head.
meaning_eng: To be struck with horror; to abandon oneself to despair.

meaning_de: Nach dem äußersten Mittel greifen, um aus einer schwierigen Lage zu gelangen.
literal_eng: To clutch at a straw.
meaning_eng: When in extreme danger, difficulty, etc., to try to seize any chance, however small or useless, of getting out of it.
equivalents_eng: To catch/clutch at a straw

meaning_de: Am Wesen einer Sache vorbeireden.
equivalents_de: wie die Katze um den heißen Brei gehen
literal_eng: To walk round and about.
meaning_eng: To avoid saying something openly, frankly, directly; to avoid the essential facts; not to come to the point; to approach a matter in a roundabout way.
equivalents_eng: To beat about the bush

meaning_de: Schabernack, Unfug treiben, ausgelassen sein.
literal_eng: To walk on one’s head.
meaning_eng: To get into mischief; to play pranks; to be naughty (usually said of children).

meaning_de: In unmittelbarer Todesgefahr schweben.
literal_eng: To walk on a brink of an abyss.
meaning_eng: To be in imminent mortal danger; to be on the verge of a disaster.
equivalents_eng: On a brink of a precipice

meaning_de: Vor j-m zittern, sich vor j-m fürchten; sich j-m widerspruchslos unterordnen, vor j-m strammstehen.
literal_eng: To walk on a string.
meaning_eng: To be completely under someone’s authority; to be very obedient, almost to the point of servility.
equivalents_eng: To be at someone’s beck and call; to dance attendance upon someone; to toe the line

literal_de: Mag da auch kein Gras wachsen.
meaning_de: Zum Ausdruck der völligen Gleichgültigkeit einer Sache gegenüber.
literal_eng: Who cares whether or not the grass grows.
meaning_eng: One couldn’t care less; it’s all the same to someone.
equivalents_eng: Not to care a straw

literal_de: So, daß man die Kugel rollen kann.
meaning_de: Absolut leer, wie ausgekehrt.
literal_eng: You could even roll a ball through it.
meaning_eng: There’s nothing there; it’s completely empty.
equivalents_eng: Bare as a bone; as bare as the palm of one’s hand.

meaning_de: Große Wissenslücken haben.
literal_eng: To limp on both legs;
meaning_eng: To have serious gaps in one’s knowledge, training or abilities.

meaning_de: Sehr dünn, mager.
literal_eng: Thin as a matchstick.
meaning_eng: Very thin.

meaning_de: J-d/etw. ist sehr wertvoll durch seine Eigenschaften, seine Vorzüge.
literal_eng: There’s no price on someone or something
meaning_eng: Someone or something is priceless, invaluable.

meaning_de: J-n nicht in Kenntnis setzen, nicht informieren (der informiert sein müßte).
literal_eng: Over someone’s head.
meaning_eng: To do something without informing one’s immediate superior; to apply to a higher authority by passing an intermediate one.
equivalents_eng: To go over someone’s head

meaning_de: Sehr langsam und wenig.
literal_eng: One teaspoonful every other hour.
meaning_eng: To be few and at long intervals; very slowly.
equivalents_eng: In drops; in/by driblets; few and far between

literal_de: Eine schwarze Katze lief (zwischen zwei Personen hindurch).
meaning_de: Es ist ein Streit zwischen... entbrannt, j-d hat sich mit j-m überworfen.
literal_eng: A black cat has run between them.
meaning_eng: There’s a coolness between them; they have become estranged.
equivalents_eng: They have fallen out

meaning_de: Klar, verständlich, unzweideutig.
literal_eng: In black on white.
meaning_eng: To declare or state something definitely, clearly, distinctly.
equivalents_eng: In black and white

meaning_de: Dreizehn Stück; die Zahl 13.
literal_eng: A devil’s dozen.
meaning_eng: Thirteen.
equivalents_eng: A devil’s/a baker’s dozen

meaning_de: Dummes Zeug reden; klatschen
literal_eng: To scratch one’s tongue.
meaning_eng: To engage in idle talk; to talk continuously; to chatter.
equivalents_eng: To wag one’s tongue

meaning_de: Den verborgenen Sinn von etw. Geschriebenem oder Gesprochenem erraten.
literal_eng: To read between the lines.
meaning_eng: To discern the concealed meaning; to draw conclusions which are not obvious in something said or written.
equivalents_eng: To read between the lines.

meaning_de: Unwahrscheinlich, ungewöhnlich (von etw., das durch seine Ungewöhnlichkeit frappiert)
literal_eng: Miracles in a sieve.
meaning_eng: It’s amazing, incredible, unbelievable extraordinary; it’s a fantastic tale.

literal_de: Mit fremden Händen die Glut zusammenscharren
meaning_de: Die Arbeitsergebnisse anderer für seine eigennützigen Zwecke nutzen.
literal_eng: To bank up the fire with someone else’s hands.
meaning_eng: To benefit by the results of someone else’s work; to use the results of someone else’s work to achieve one’s selfish ends.
equivalents_eng: To make a cat’s-paw of someone; to pull someone’s chestnuts out of the fire.

literal_de: Wir werden j-n mit Mützen bewerfen.
meaning_de: Prahlerische Beteuerung, etw. leicht und rasch zu überwinden.
literal_eng: We’ll pelt you (him, etc.) with our caps.
meaning_eng: We expect to win without difficulty; it’s as good as certain (to boast of an easy victory).
equivalents_eng: It’s a walk-over; it’s in the bag

meaning_de: Eine zufällige, oberflächliche Bekanntschaft.
literal_eng: A cap acquaintance.
meaning_eng: A slight acquaintance.
equivalents_eng: A nodding/bowing acquaintance

meaning_de: Ungeschickt verdeckt; schlecht verhohlen.
literal_eng: It is sewn with white thread.
meaning_eng: It is a flimsy story or excuse easily seen through; it is all too obvious; it is quite transparent.
equivalents_eng: Something does not hold water; made up out of whole cloth.

meaning_de: Wir gehen zu ernsten Gesprächen, zur Sache über.
literal_eng: Jokes aside.
meaning_eng: Speaking seriously; it’s a serious matter; let’s get down to business.
equivalents_eng: Joking apart/aside; all kidding aside.

meaning_de: Von einer dichten Menschenansammlung; die Menschen stehen dichtgedrängt.
equivalents_de: kein Apfel konnte zur Erde fallen
literal_eng: No room for an apple to fall.
meaning_eng: Used to indicate that there is a large number of people in one place, that the place is overcrowded, that there is hardly room to move or turn around.
equivalents_eng: There’s no room to swing a cat

literal_de: Du wirst dir die Zunge abbrechen.
meaning_de: Etw. ist sehr schwer auszusprechen.
equivalents_de: an dem Wort kann man sich die Zunge abbrechen
literal_eng: You can break your tongue.
meaning_eng: It’s very difficult to pronounce a word or a phrase.
equivalents_eng: You can break /twist your tongue

meaning_de: J-d kann fließend sprechen; j-d versteht es, die Worte zu setzen.
literal_eng: One’s tongue is hung well.
meaning_eng: Someone is a smooth talker; someone has a glib tongue.
equivalents_eng: To have the gift of the gab.

meaning_de: Vollkommen klar.
equivalents_de: sonnenklar; das ist mit Händen zu greifen
literal_eng: Clear as day.
meaning_eng: Easy to see or comprehend; quite evident, obvious; as plain or clear as can be.
equivalents_eng: As plain as the nose on your face; as plain as day
